item.title: [Resolved] Fedora Infra - Datacenter Move outage
item.description: Fedora Infrastructure is currently ongoing migration to different datacenter, during this migration majority of the contributor-facing services will be down. Therefore it is expected that sync-release (i.e., propose-downstream and pull-from-upstream), koji_build, and bodhi_update Packit workflows will be affected. Copr build jobs may be disrupted, full outage is not expected. For more details watch: Fedora Infrastructure Status Tracking issue for the datacenter move Update - 4th July Most services in Fedora Infrastructure should be up and running again.
item.content:
Fedora Infrastructure is currently ongoing migration to different datacenter, during this migration majority of the contributor-facing services will be down.

Therefore it is expected that sync-release (i.e., propose-downstream and pull-from-upstream), koji_build, and bodhi_update Packit workflows will be affected.

Copr build jobs may be disrupted, full outage is not expected.

For more details watch:

  • Fedora Infrastructure Status
  • Tracking issue for the datacenter move

Update - 4th July

Most services in Fedora Infrastructure should be up and running again. Packit has resumed processing copr_build jobs, but there are still delays due to jobs being queued during the outage in previous days. We are continuing to investigate issues related to pushing and pulling from dist-git, which are currently impacting downstream jobs. Weâ€™ll share further updates as soon as we have more information.

item.title: [Resolved] Copr SRPM builds failing
item.description: SRPM builds in Copr have been failing, the reason is still unknown, please be patient. You can monitor #buildsys:fedoraproject.org on Matrix for updates. Update: Copr SRPM builds are working again. You can retrigger failed jobs with /packit build or /packit rebuild-failed.
item.content:
SRPM builds in Copr have been failing, the reason is still unknown, please be patient. You can monitor #buildsys:fedoraproject.org on Matrix for updates.

Update: Copr SRPM builds are working again. You can retrigger failed jobs with /packit build or /packit rebuild-failed.

item.title: [Resolved] Maintenance outage
item.description: Today’s weekly production deployment requires a smaller outage to ensure proper redeployment without any inconsistencies. We expect an outage for up to 15 minutes. There will be no jobs processed from 2025-02-03 15:15 UTC till the successful redeployment. In case you are affected, please retrigger the jobs accordingly (via comments, or Re-Run button on GitHub Checks) once the outage is over. Thanks for the understanding.
item.content:
Today’s weekly production deployment requires a smaller outage to ensure proper redeployment without any inconsistencies.

We expect an outage for up to 15 minutes. There will be no jobs processed from 2025-02-03 15:15 UTC till the successful redeployment.

In case you are affected, please retrigger the jobs accordingly (via comments, or Re-Run button on GitHub Checks) once the outage is over.

Thanks for the understanding.

item.title: [Resolved] Copr outage
item.description: Copr services are temporarily unavailable due to a service disruption. In Packit, this results in Copr builds stuck in a pending state.
item.content:
Copr services are temporarily unavailable due to a service disruption.

In Packit, this results in Copr builds stuck in a pending state.

item.title: [Resolved] Copr outage - system update
item.description: There is a Copr outage and as a result Copr builds can be stuck in a pending state. Update: the outage is over, any pending jobs should be processed automatically. In case some jobs failed to be triggered, you can trigger them manually.
item.content:
There is a Copr outage and as a result Copr builds can be stuck in a pending state.

Update: the outage is over, any pending jobs should be processed automatically. In case some jobs failed to be triggered, you can trigger them manually.

item.title: [Resolved] Maintenance outage
item.description: Database volume needs to be enlarged to accomodate the load on the Packit Service. To minimize the amount of jobs affected by this maintenance there will be no jobs processed, but they should be enqueued until the outage is over. In case you are affected, please retrigger the jobs accordingly (via comment on the affected pull requests, or Re-Run button on GitHub Checks). Thanks for understanding.
item.content:
Database volume needs to be enlarged to accomodate the load on the Packit Service. To minimize the amount of jobs affected by this maintenance there will be no jobs processed, but they should be enqueued until the outage is over.

In case you are affected, please retrigger the jobs accordingly (via comment on the affected pull requests, or Re-Run button on GitHub Checks).

Thanks for understanding.

item.title: [Resolved] Fedora infrastructure outage
item.description: Fedora infrastructure is having an outage resulting in some Copr build jobs failing with error Failed to download metadata... Librepo error: Cannot download repomd.xml... You can watch the status of the issue here: https://pagure.io/fedora-infrastructure/issue/12183.
item.content: Fedora infrastructure is having an outage resulting in some Copr build jobs failing with error Failed to download metadata... Librepo error: Cannot download repomd.xml... You can watch the status of the issue here: https://pagure.io/fedora-infrastructure/issue/12183.

item.title: [Resolved] Many Copr builds pending
item.description: The Copr backend is under a huge load and many builds are still in a pending state. The Copr builds will take more time than usual to finish. You can monitor the pending queue here: https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/status/stats/.
item.content: The Copr backend is under a huge load and many builds are still in a pending state. The Copr builds will take more time than usual to finish. You can monitor the pending queue here: https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/status/stats/.

item.title: [Resolved] Copr builds stuck in pending or running state
item.description: Copr builds could have been stuck in a pending or running state. The issue has been resolved, it may take a while for the affected Copr builds to finish, but there is no need to retrigger them.
item.content: Copr builds could have been stuck in a pending or running state. The issue has been resolved, it may take a while for the affected Copr builds to finish, but there is no need to retrigger them.

item.title: [Resolved] Copr Upgrade
item.description: Due to an upgrade of the Fedora Copr Servers, Copr builds might have been delayed or failing.
item.content: Due to an upgrade of the Fedora Copr Servers, Copr builds might have been delayed or failing.

item.title: [Resolved] GitLab.com outage
item.description: GitLab.com workflows are disrupted due to the issue with detecting the upstream/downstream repository in the current working directory. Self-hosted GitLab forges are not affected.
item.content:
GitLab.com workflows are disrupted due to the issue with detecting the upstream/downstream repository in the current working directory.

Self-hosted GitLab forges are not affected.

item.title: [Resolved] COPR build failures
item.description: Copr is experiencing issues with builds. We are sorry about that. You can follow the progress in the Copr issue. The failure in the COPR logs looks like the following: Machine 5b8689e424334255ab9ace8a58343076 still running. Killing... In case you are building in your own COPR project you can go to your project settings and change Mock bootstrap from default to Enable for a quick workaround.
item.content:
Copr is experiencing issues with builds. We are sorry about that. You can follow the progress in the Copr issue.

The failure in the COPR logs looks like the following: Machine 5b8689e424334255ab9ace8a58343076 still running. Killing...

In case you are building in your own COPR project you can go to your project settings and change Mock bootstrap from default to Enable for a quick workaround.

item.title: [Resolved] Copr frontend instability
item.description: Copr is experiencing issues with its frontend which is currently mitigated while Copr team investigates. In case some of your builds were not submitted, please retrigger.
item.content:
Copr is experiencing issues with its frontend which is currently mitigated while Copr team investigates.

In case some of your builds were not submitted, please retrigger.

item.title: [Resolved] Copr Upgrade
item.description: There will be a Copr outage starting at date --date "2023-08-16 12:30 UTC" which will last approximately 2 hours. The build queue processing will be stopped. During the outage time, we expect a very short downtime for the DNF package storage (less than 10 minutes). Reason for outage: We will update the infrastructure machines to the latest packages that are currently being developed. Affected Services: https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/ https://download.copr.fedorainfracloud.org/results/ Upstream ticket: https://github.com/fedora-copr/copr/issues/2824
item.content:
There will be a Copr outage starting at

date --date "2023-08-16 12:30 UTC"

which will last approximately 2 hours. The build queue processing will be stopped. During the outage time, we expect a very short downtime for the DNF package storage (less than 10 minutes).

Reason for outage:

We will update the infrastructure machines to the latest packages that are currently being developed.

Affected Services:

https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/ https://download.copr.fedorainfracloud.org/results/

Upstream ticket:

https://github.com/fedora-copr/copr/issues/2824

Please join #fedora-buildsys, #fedora-admin or #fedora-noc on irc.libera.chat or add comments to this ticket.

item.title: [Resolved] Upgrade of Copr servers
item.description: Due to an upgrade of the Fedora Copr Servers, Copr builds might be delayed or failing. The upgrade should last approximately 3 hours.
item.content: Due to an upgrade of the Fedora Copr Servers, Copr builds might be delayed or failing. The upgrade should last approximately 3 hours.

item.title: [Resolved] Upgrade of Copr servers
item.description: Due to an upgrade of the Fedora Copr Servers, Copr builds might be delayed or failing. The upgrade should last approximately 3 hours.
item.content: Due to an upgrade of the Fedora Copr Servers, Copr builds might be delayed or failing. The upgrade should last approximately 3 hours.

item.title: [Resolved] Running grouping migrations
item.description: We are updating our database schema to facilitate further development. As a part of this process, multiple database migrations will have to be run. The first step is grouping together related builds and test runs. The migrations will happen during the next deployment to production, on Tuesday February 14 at 2:00AM CET. This set of migrations is expected to take roughly 40 minutes, after which the service should come back up.
item.content:
We are updating our database schema to facilitate further development. As a part of this process, multiple database migrations will have to be run. The first step is grouping together related builds and test runs. The migrations will happen during the next deployment to production, on Tuesday February 14 at 2:00AM CET. This set of migrations is expected to take roughly 40 minutes, after which the service should come back up.

Since significant refactoring was paired with these changes, there may be some bugs/regressions that we did not spot on staging. Please, contact us via the usual means if you spot anything suspicious.

item.title: [Resolved] Upgrade of Copr Servers
item.description: Due to an upgrade of the Fedora Copr Servers, Copr builds might have been failing.
item.content: Due to an upgrade of the Fedora Copr Servers, Copr builds might have been failing.

item.title: [Resolved] Copr storage move
item.description: Copr team is performing a backend storage move over the weekend of Oct 28-30th. Building in Copr will be disrupted or unavailable during this period. For more info, please follow the Copr outage announcement. Update: the upgrade was successful and Copr is fully operational.
item.content:
Copr team is performing a backend storage move over the weekend of Oct 28-30th. Building in Copr will be disrupted or unavailable during this period.

For more info, please follow the Copr outage announcement.

Update: the upgrade was successful and Copr is fully operational.

item.title: [Resolved] Issues with the task execution
item.description: We are experiencing issues with the execution of the tasks. (The statuses are waiting in the The task was accepted. state.) We are investigating the cause. Sorry about the possible troubles. We will try to fix this as soon as possible. Updates: Tue Oct 11 12:24:02 UTC: We are slowly going through the queue. Please, be patient. Tue Oct 11 13:12:36 UTC: We have gone through the queue and you should experience regular response times.
item.content:
We are experiencing issues with the execution of the tasks. (The statuses are waiting in the The task was accepted. state.) We are investigating the cause. Sorry about the possible troubles. We will try to fix this as soon as possible.

Updates:

  • Tue Oct 11 12:24:02 UTC: We are slowly going through the queue. Please, be patient.
  • Tue Oct 11 13:12:36 UTC: We have gone through the queue and you should experience regular response times. The original cause is still not known but the problem probably occured during an SRPM upload to Copr. (It can be a fault on our or Copr side.)
  • Wed Oct 12 05:27:46 UTC: Service operated normally since the last update. To reduce the chance of this, we plan to move the building of SRPMs to Copr. (Currently default for new installations and opt in for other projects.)

item.title: [Resolved] Upgrade of Copr Servers
item.description: Due to an ongoing upgrade of the Fedora Copr Servers, building might be delayed or failing. The upgrade should last ~3 hours.
item.content: Due to an ongoing upgrade of the Fedora Copr Servers, building might be delayed or failing. The upgrade should last ~3 hours.
